column4: but the laptop I'm on seems to be getting an IP from DHCP just fine
try plugging the computer directly to the router instead of the switch and than plugging it back into the switch after it has obtained an IP?
Not really an option. The machines are in different rooms.
move it
and than move it back
trust me it will turn back on
from the ubuntu fresh installed?
Yeah. It wouldn't even get an IP during the installation process
does the windows machine give you an issue with two machines getting the same IP?
Not sure what you're asking.
unplug your switch take out the input and stick it in the machine. obtain an IP. Plug the switch back in. Than plug the internet back into the switch
Worth a shot I suppose. Gonna lose connection while I do that, of course.
its ok you know where to finds us :)
so did you fix it?
SOmewhat: I tried a DIFFERENT switch. And it's working.
I only have one switch so if its not working I'm in trouble :)
well in that case I was just trying to make you feel better I have 3 routers and 1 switch :p
all wireless (not switch)
There's only so high I can have the router
buy a longer cord :p
nivida is also a network adapter in some machines
Fortunately not in this system. But no, it was specifically telling me to install the drivers for the Geforce
my HP had both so I was like erf?
He specifically asked for console
